results.description: Alloa climb away from the foot of the Championship with a home win over Dunfermline.
results.shortTitle: Alloa off bottom after win over Dunfermline
results.title: Alloa Athletic 2-1 Dunfermline Athletic

results.description: Dunfermline Athletic ease past Queen of the South to record back-to-back Scottish Championship wins for the first time this season.
results.shortTitle: Dunfermline beat Queen's for back-to-back wins
results.title: Dunfermline Athletic 2-0 Queen of the South: hosts earn back-to-back wins for first tie this term

results.description: A brace from striker Kevin Nisbet earned Dunfermline a hard-fought win against a stuffy Arbroath side to move to sixth in the Scottish Championship.
results.shortTitle: Nisbet brace gives Pars win over Arbroath
results.title: Dunfermline 2-0 Arbroath: Nisbet brace gives hosts victory

results.description: Dundee United capitalise on Ayr's Friday night defeat by beating Dunfermline to move three points clear at the top of the Championship.
results.shortTitle: Dundee United move three points clear at top
results.title: Dundee United 2-0 Dunfermline Athletic: Robbie Neilson's side three points clear at top

thumbnail.altText: Dundee United's Nicky Clark celebrates the second goal

results.description: Andy Ryan scores a late winner as Dunfermline beat Ayr to post their first home Scottish Championship win of the season.
results.shortTitle: Dunfermline beat Ayr to gain first home win
results.title: Dunfermline Athletic 3-2 Ayr United: First home win of season for Pars

results.description: Jim McAlister's injury-time goal rescues a point for Morton after Andy Ryan's late strike had Dunfermline on course for a rare Scottish Championship win.
results.shortTitle: McAlister strikes at death to deny Pars
results.title: Morton 1-1 Dunfermline: Two goals in six minutes earn point apiece

thumbnail.altText: Dunfermline sit in ninth spot after just one win in five Championship games.

results.description: Dunfermline and Alloa share the spoils as Adam Brown's goal lights up the Championship clash at East End Park.
results.shortTitle: Alloa bottom despite draw with Dunfermline
results.title: Dunfermline Athletic 1-1 Alloa Athletic

thumbnail.altText: Adam Brown's goal gave Alloa the lead at Dunfermline

results.description: Managerless Partick Thistle slip to bottom place in the Scottish Championship after being thumped by Dunfermline Athletic.
results.shortTitle: Managerless Thistle bottom after rout
results.title: Partick Thistle 0-3 Dunfermline Athletic: Manager-less Thistle bottom after Pars dominate

results.description: Former Hearts, Kilmarnock and Falkirk manager Jim Jefferies is recovering after suffering a heart attack.
results.shortTitle: Jefferies recovering after heart attack
results.title: Former Hearts manager Jim Jefferies suffers heart attack

results.description: Dunfermline Athletic remain bottom of the Scottish Championship after a late Sean Welsh penalty hoists Inverness Caledonian Thistle up to third.
results.shortTitle: Inverness CT win at Pars to move third
results.title: Dunfermline Athletic 0-1 Inverness CT: Late Sean Welsh penalty sends visitors up to third

results.description: All the arrivals and departures during summer 2019 in the Scottish Championship.
results.shortTitle: Scottish Championship summer ins and outs
results.title: Scottish Championship ins and outs - Summer 2019

results.description: Dundee join city rivals Dundee United in being knocked out of the Challenge Cup third round after a 2-1 home defeat by League Two side Elgin City.
results.shortTitle: Both Dundee clubs out of Challenge Cup
results.title: Scottish Challenge Cup: Dundee lose to Elgin, Dundee United defeated on penalties by Arbroath

thumbnail.altText: Elgin's Shane Sutherland celebrates against Dundee

results.description: Greg Kiltie says he joined Dunfermline Athletic on loan as he was not "given a fair chance" by Kilmarnock manager Angelo Alessio.
results.shortTitle: 'Alessio didn't give me fair chance'
results.title: Greg Kiltie: Kilmarnock's Angelo Alessio did not give me 'a fair chance' before Dunfermline move

results.description: Luke Donnelly fires in the only goal as Arbroath see off Dunfermline at windy Gayfield to move up to fourth in the Championship.
results.shortTitle: Arbroath move fourth in Championship
results.title: Arbroath 1-0 Dunfermline: Donnelly moves Arbroath fourth in Championship

results.description: Japanese midfielder Ryotaro Meshino says he turned down other European clubs to join Hearts on loan from Manchester City.
results.shortTitle: Manchester City's Meshino joins Hearts
results.title: Ryotaro Meshino: Hearts sign Manchester City midfielder on loan

thumbnail.altText: Ryotaro Meshino shows off his number 77 shirt at Hearts

results.description: Dundee United kept up their 100% league record with a convincing victory over Dunfermline at East End Park.
results.shortTitle: Shankland double as Dundee Utd win again
results.title: Dunfermline Athletic 0-2 Dundee United: Lawrence Shankland double for visitors

results.description: The SFA compliance officer is to review comments made by former Celtic captain Tom Boyd about John Beaton during Saturday's match against Dunfermline.
results.shortTitle: Boyd referee remarks to be reviewed
results.title: Tom Boyd's comments about referee reviewed by SFA compliance officer

results.description: Neil Lennon praises his Celtic players for purging their Champions League disappointment by beating Dunfermline in the League Cup.
results.shortTitle: Lennon 'proud' of Celtic response
results.title: Celtic: Neil Lennon praises side following League Cup victory

results.description: James Forrest's strike in extra-time saved Celtic's blushes as they edged past Championship Dunfermline to reach the quarter-finals of the League Cup.
results.shortTitle: Forrest fires Celtic into last eight
results.title: Celtic 2-1 Dunfermline (AET): Forrest strike edges holders into League Cup quarter-finals

results.description: Queen of the South striker Gary Oliver strikes in the second half to deny Dunfermline Athletic a first win of the Scottish Championship season.
results.shortTitle: Oliver earns Queens point against Pars
results.title: Queen of the South 1-1 Dunfermline Athletic: Gary Oliver earns point
